mcq.statement: What does the idiom 'Don't give up the day job' imply?

options.a: To work during the day and rest at night
options.b: To keep one's main source of income and not pursue something risky
options.c: To take a vacation from work
options.d: To work two jobs to make ends meet

mcq.one_liner: The idiom 'Don't give up the day job' is a humorous way of telling someone not to leave their regular job because they are not very good at something else they are attempting.
